How to Install 2ping on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • 2ping

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install 2ping on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing 2ping on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall 2ping in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install 2ping, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install 2ping Using apt

To install 2ping in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install 2ping using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install 2ping

The installation of 2ping might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install 2ping Using apt-get

To install 2ping using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install 2ping.

sudo apt-get -y install 2ping

Install 2ping Using Synaptic

To install 2ping using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install 2ping on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for 2ping. This will display the 2ping package in the package window, now to install 2ping, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the 2ping package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of 2ping.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install 2ping Using aptitude

To install 2ping on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of 2ping.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install 2ping using the command aptitude install 2ping.

sudo aptitude -y install 2ping

How to Upgrade 2ping on debian

If you want to upgrade the 2ping package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade 2ping using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade 2ping to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade 2ping.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade 2ping sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade 2ping

Upgrade 2ping using Aptitude

To upgrade 2ping using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade 2ping.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade 2ping

Upgrade 2ping using Synaptic

To upgrade 2ping using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for 2ping, now right-click 2ping, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade 2ping just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall 2ping on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall 2ping from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just 2ping, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove 2ping

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of 2ping

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of 2ping you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge 2ping

Remove 2ping using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall 2ping using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for 2ping, right-click the 2ping package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall 2ping click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install 2ping on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade 2ping using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.
